column4: Maine mourns the passing of the extraordinary and courageous Travis Roy.  He helped and inspired so many.  Rest in Peace.

Nearly $41 million has been awarded to help offset the financial harm Maine farmers have experienced amid COVID-19. I worked to secure this funding for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program & extend the deadline. Farmers have until Dec. 11 to apply: https://t.co/bAhpAa8sKH

I joined Central Maine Healthcare & community leaders in Lewiston at a groundbreaking ceremony for the CMH Cancer Care Center. https://t.co/1V0gXWOvjY

https://t.co/aWy6RpER7a

Happy National Forest Products Week & Bioenergy Day! Maine’s natural resources provide an abundance of renewable energy, good-paying jobs, & recreational opportunities. I will continue to support the hardworking men & women in this industry & our rural communities. https://t.co/zJS5OLunFR

https://t.co/NtKmnzvGp5
I appreciate APTA’s leadership & advocacy on this issue. I will continue to champion home health services so that all Americans are able to access this critical care.

The pandemic & drought have created severe challenges for Maine farmers. I advocated for the $35 million Maine farmers received to date in COVID-19 relief, & USDA’s drought disaster declaration will provide additional support. 

 https://t.co/lih1NNAkn0

https://t.co/Q4cFbMNjGn

https://t.co/kjslPcJotg https://t.co/oXq9l8EL7L

https://t.co/bZyetPEe5f

At @EcologySchoolME in Saco today, I took part in a celebration of a new dormitory & dining commons, which will be among the most sustainable buildings in the Northeast once completed. Supporting Maine’s dairy, potato, & specialty crop farmers has always been one of my top priorities. I was honored to receive the Friend of the Farm Bureau Award at Misty Meadows Farm in Clinton today.  I will continue to advocate for Maine farmers & help keep agriculture strong. https://t.co/fThEAuqxbU

I spoke with the hardworking members of @PLCofMaine this morning about the challenges they face & how we can continue to work together to support the forest products industry & rural communities. I wrote a bipartisan bill to provide direct economic relief for loggers & haulers https://t.co/PEFPArFNt1

Following a bipartisan effort I helped lead, the USDA took action to ensure that students in Maine & across the country continue to have access to free school meals through June 2021, regardless of whether they are learning in the classroom or virtually.

https://t.co/m2UEYHiQQA

Throughout the pandemic, @Wabanaki_PH has continued providing quality health care to Maine tribes. I visited their Bangor office to thank staff for their work. As a member of the Appropriations Committee, I’m committed to supporting their efforts to improve tribal members’ health https://t.co/fS4ZslVUbf

I visited CES Inc. in Bangor to tour the renovated office & meet with employees. I’m pleased that this employee-owned firm of engineers, environmental scientists, & surveyors received a forgivable loan through the PPP I co-authored, supporting more than 100 jobs. https://t.co/PkfybQehBZ

The Biddeford, Saco, Old Orchard Beach Transit Committee was awarded nearly $450,000 through the CARES Act to improve the safety, efficiency, & reliability of its public transportation system. I toured Bar Harbor Foods in Whiting & spoke with the company’s dedicated employees. As a leading producer of seafood products, @barharborfoods exemplifies the Maine spirit of hard work. I will continue to support our seafood processors and fisheries amid COVID-19. https://t.co/IkWe4TRT3O

Eastport Municipal Airport connects Downeast Maine to the world & provides critical access to LifeFlight. Today I joined the groundbreaking of an infrastructure project funded by a $5.8 million grant I secured. This project will enhance safety, improve travel, & generate jobs. https://t.co/97K2HE2ZVU

I joined the start of an exciting project between Puritan & Cianbro that will provide a boost in our fight against COVID-19. The Senate unanimously passed a bipartisan resolution I cosponsored recognizing October as National Retirement Security Month. As Chairman of @SenateAging, I’ve held multiple hearings on retirement security & authored legislation making it easier to save. https://t.co/oFcZguVExE

Maine employers & farmers depend on the International Marine Terminal in Portland. I secured a $4.1 million grant for improvements at the terminal that will create additional jobs, increase the export of Maine products, & support our rural economies.

https://t.co/PA4J0alF84

I visited American Steel & Aluminum in South Portland, which serves as a job-creating economic engine in Southern Maine. I'm pleased that ASA received a forgivable loan through the PPP, helping to sustain the jobs of 153 skilled employees, including 60 in South Portland. https://t.co/VaD8lV81ad

In order to continue to protect health care workers & help mitigate the spread of COVID-19, Maine has been awarded nearly $2.3 million to purchase additional PPE. As we combat this ongoing pandemic, it’s imperative that we keep those on the frontline safe.
https://t.co/CYsADQNPwf

In Bridgton today, I saw the exciting work being done to enhance the streetscape & improve the water infrastructure with the help of federal funding. Bridgton is already a destination for outdoor recreationalists, & these investments will help attract more visitors & jobs. https://t.co/6m5VlA4erX

I toured Pemberton’s Gourmet Foods in Gray & met w/ employees. Maine’s food & beverage manufacturing companies have seen significant growth in recent years. I'm delighted that the PPP I co-authored helped keep this small business strong & its workers employed during the pandemic. https://t.co/9koRohE7Sz

I spoke with @UMaine President Ferrini-Mundy about how these grants will allow the university system to build on the world-class education they provide. I applaud the Alfond Foundation for this investment in Maine’s institutions of higher education, our young people, & our state.

This transformational $500 million gift to Maine’s colleges & universities & their community partners will provide a tremendous boost to science & technology programs throughout Maine & will ensure our state remains a leader in cutting-edge research.

https://t.co/GsIPAUvumW

As a senior member of the Appropriations Committee, I helped secure the funding for @UMaine to develop this technology & the funding that led to the recent $3.9 million contract award for GSS to scale up production of its hybrid composite secure shipping containers. https://t.co/Q7SPzUlvNv

I visited Global Secure Shipping in Old Town to tour the production line, meet with employees, & participate in a ribbon cutting for GSS’s new shipping container & facility. GSS is helping to keep our seaport cargo safe, while creating new Maine jobs through R&D & manufacturing. https://t.co/94WqhjatmQ

I met with members of the @MainePCA to discuss threats to the 340B Drug Pricing Program, which is critical to both patients & the vitality of our rural health infrastructure. HHS must hold pharmaceutical companies accountable that are threatening to undermine it. https://t.co/vaHEnAc5jg

Federal firefighters protect critical U.S. assets, including PNSY in Kittery & Naval Support Activity Cutler. To better accommodate their uncommon work hours, I introduced a bill to allow federal firefighters to trade shifts without affecting their pay.

https://t.co/9qyk09NUpU

The closure of the U.S.-Canada border to all but essential travel despite the apparent low risk of cross-border COVID-19 transmission has harmed many families & small businesses. That’s why Maine’s & NH’s U.S. Senators urged the Administration to reevaluate these restrictions. https://t.co/xR9hXGKKuq

An additional $20 billion is available for medical providers to help fight COVID-19 & protect our communities. Maine hospitals, rural health clinics, assisted living facilities, mental health & addiction services, & others can begin applying today at https://t.co/7SbDUbSnj2
If you or a loved one would like to learn more, please call the VA’s Caregiver Support Line at 855-260-3274 or visit the VA Caregiver Program website at https://t.co/enfEmF6hUI

The VA Caregiver Support Program has been a lifeline to caregivers of post-9/11 veterans. I co-authored the law extending eligibility to caregivers of veterans of all eras, & now the first phase of that expansion—veterans injured in the line of duty before May 7, 1975—is open.

Keeping people affordably & stably housed amid COVID-19 while not bankrupting small property owners is both a moral imperative & a public health necessity. The Administration must prioritize coupling the eviction moratorium with rental assistance.

https://t.co/rUq034hSsP

It was an honor to offer a few words at Maine’s annual Fallen Firefighters Memorial Service, which was held virtually this year. Today is also the start of National Fire Prevention Week, which reminds us to keep our communities safe & express gratitude to our brave firefighters. https://t.co/3Nb9uTdBNG

I have tested negative for COVID. Although I had almost no contact with my three colleagues who have tested positive, I thought it prudent to get tested.  My thoughts are with the President, FLOTUS, my colleagues & all who are infected.

I attended the dedication ceremony for Anniversary Park & the St. Louis Bell Tower in Auburn. The Opportunity Zones program created through the 2017 tax reform law will help boost the private investment that will be critical to the city's redevelopment plans. https://t.co/eNWtZtZOFK

With assistance from federal programs that I've championed—including BUILD & PPP—Waterville’s revitalization has been a catalyst for job creation. I'll continue to fight for programs that support Maine’s small businesses & that assist communities as we battle COVID-19.

I hosted my friend @SenatorTimScott in Maine to show him Waterville's exciting redevelopment projects. As the author of the Opportunity Zone provision in the 2017 tax reform law, Sen. Scott has been a great partner in supporting our small businesses & underserved communities. https://t.co/1aCQV5Szek

York Rotary’s response to the pandemic is a great example of how Rotarians give back. Their volunteer efforts have included meal delivery service, which has been vital to seniors & families. I attended their meeting to provide an update on our work to combat COVID-19. https://t.co/Z9Muyb6aDH

$800,000 has been awarded to support mental health & substance use programs in communities across Maine. I’ll continue to fight to help ensure Mainers have access to the resources they need to achieve recovery & healing.

I first met Aidan—who is now a freshman—when he was four & testified at a hearing. https://t.co/GP7q5gl2a8

https://t.co/E6OtIkx5zf

$8 million has been awarded to support conservation around Sebago Lake, which provides drinking water to one-sixth of Maine’s population and is a major draw for outdoor recreationalists. This investment will help preserve this pristine natural resource.

https://t.co/74apnFKYhk

I spoke with Maine adult education leaders about the need to support our students amid COVID-19. $200,000 was awarded to Maine through the BOLD Act I authored to expand support services for people with Alzheimer’s disease & dementia. I will continue to work to support the thousands of Mainers living with this disease.

This afternoon, I visited the U.S. Supreme Court to pay my respects to Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, an extraordinary American who spent her entire life fighting for equality & fairness.
